detailsOfAchievement: AIMS AND OBJECTIVES OF THE TRUST a. To educate the people of India in hygiene, health etc; and prevent young people from alcohol, drugs and immoral traffic etc; and for that purpose utilize visual media by producing and broadcasting T.V programmes, radio programmes etc; using modern information technology methods. b. To provide assistance or help to the poor, the needy, and the old. c. To give assistance for marriage of poor women. d. To give financial help for maintenance of houses for poor people and construction of houses for the homeless. e. To provide assistance financial or otherwise in whatever manner as it may deem fit for the Trust in case of flood, drought, earthquake, famine and other calamities. f. To rehabilitate people affected with AIDS, cancer and leprosy or give assistance for their rehabilitation. g. To institute centres for rehabilitation of mentally retarded and physically handicapped people. h. To run tailoring schools for helping the financially struggling men / women to help to find their own income i. To provide assistance both financially and consultant-wise support and involve in cattle stocks (live stocks, eg. Cow, sheep, chicken, etc.) Vocations. j. To start and run vocational training centres for young people to find their own income. k. To provide assistance and help to the physically and mentally sick. l. To provide assistance financially for farming and also to involve by giving financial and consultant support to the poor and the needy. m. To establish, and maintain Old Age Homes, Orphanages, Destitute Homes, etc to accommodate the ageing, suffering and other needy people. n. To establish, maintain and run studentships, scholarships and render other kind of aid to students including supply of books, stipends, medals and other incentives to study. o. To conduct camps, conferences, seminar workshops etc for propagation or imparting training in practicing any of the objects of the Trust. p. To disseminate the high values of life, through house visits, awareness conventions, counseling etc, and work against alcoholism, drug addiction, smoking, obscenity etc. q. To open and operate schools or other educational institutions to impart formal or non-formal education. r. To do any other objects of general public utility not involving any business, commerce or trade. s. To establish, develop, maintain and grant aid in cash or in kind to hostels, hospitals, medical schools, medical colleges, nursing institutions, dispensaries, maternities, child welfare centers and/ or such other similar charitable institutions in India for the benefit and use of general public. t. To initiate and implement rural development programmes and projects for the uplift of the poor, maintenance of drinking water projects in rural areas and urban slums, dwelling units and school buildings for the benefit of the economically weaker sections of the society. u. To provide monetary assistance to i) Deserving students whether they are directly under the care of the trust or not. ii) deserving children for medical purpose whether they are under the direct care of the trust or not iii) any destitute

detailsOfAchievement: ATTAKKALARI PUBLIC CHARITABLE TRUST HO: 39_3525, KAUSTHUBHAM, MANIKKATH ROAD, RAVIPURAM, KOCHI, ERNAKULAM _ 682 016 PROJECT OFFICE: ATTAKKALARI CENTRE FOR MOVEMENT ARTS, 24-04, BTS BUS DEPOT ROAD, WILSON GARDEN, BANGALORE â€“ 27 Attakkalari Public Charitable Trust of Contemporary Performing Arts is the only umbrella organization of its kind in India, creating a context for contemporary cultural expressions through many distinct but interlinked programs. 1. Launched in 2006, the DIPLOMA IN MOVEMENT ARTS AND MIXED MEDIA is the only programme in India that offers a full-time professional training in Contemporary Dance and allied disciplines. Currently offered as a one-year intensive, graduates may choose to continue to train and earn for a further period of two years with Attakkalari. 2. An interdisciplinary choreography lab FACETS was held in 2002, 2004 and 2006. Over the duration of the three-week residential laboratory, dancers and choreographers work with different contemporary movement techniques and Indian physical traditions and utilize existing and emerging technologies as creative tools for artistic expression. 3. Attakkalari set up the Education Outreach Programme (EOP) over six years ago to integrate the movement arts into the mainstream curriculum in schools to facilitate the holistic development of the child. Offering dance education on an unprecedented scale, Attakkalari facilitators have taught in approximately 60 schools across the economic divide and reached over 6000 children. Attakkalari conducts community dance classes every evening and also on weekends, as well as, workshops and classes for corporates and others. 4. Over the years, Attakkalari has undertaken in-depth research into the teaching methodologies in Indian performing arts traditions. The knowledge of these independent projects led to a major research project, NAGARIKA an Integrated Information System on Indian Physical Expressions through Technology. The project compiles and categorizes movement sequences of two specific Indian movement traditions â€“Bharatanatyam and Kalarippayattu. The interactive DVD on Bharatanatyam is ready. 5. Attakkalariâ€™s Repertory Company has given young boys and girls, many of who are from underprivileged sections of society, a chance to earn a sustainable livelihood while pursuing their passion in the arts. Attakkalariâ€™s productions are at the forefront of the contemporary Indian dance scene and incorporate cutting-edge digital arts, imaginative lighting and innovative music. In the last three years productions include CHRONOTOPIA, CITY ON THE MOVE, NAGARANTHARA and PURUSHARTHA. Attakkalari has performed across India, at several major European festivals, UK, Japan and is scheduled to perform in Korea also. 6. TransMedia Technologies aims to provide much needed training for designers, technicians, choreographers, dancers and actors in stage technologies. Since its inception in Bangalore, this division of Attakkalari has earned a name for itself for providing quality, cost effective services in light and sound solutions for performance groups. 8. Attakkalari India Biennial celebrates the combined visions of artists in dance, sound, digital arts and design from all over India and abroad. The recently concluded festival held from February 6th -15th brought together 300 artistes from more than 20 countries in a series of performances and related events.

detailsOfAchievement: 1. Women Rights Promotion and Protection in the State of Kerala: To develop women in Kerala to involve in the issues of women and develop them to work for the protection of their rights, by strengthening state and district level coordination committees formed a state level women piloted women organization with the name WOMENS VOICE, consisting 6000 members having fourteen district level coordination committees. To protect the rights of house wives in the state, helped WOMENS VOICE to mobilize house wives and formed National House Wives Association consisting 4866 members. Focusing on mobilizing women in unorganized sector, formed district level apex bodies in 14 districts. Organizes facilitation programs on women friendly Acts and Laws. Functions as Service Providing Center and counseling center with the assistance of Kerala State Social Welfare Board. Provides legal advices and support to the needy through the legal center. Runs a women resource center as part of information dissemination. 2. Strengthening the livelihood aspects of the tribal in Wayanad through FRA: This was a project to promote the tribal communities to advocate for the effective implementation of The Forest Rights Act enacted by Indian Parliament. Through this project submitted claim forms and helped the tribal to get minimum land as per the Act. Organized facilitation programs on Tribal friendly Acts and Laws. 3. Jalanidhi: Through Jalanidhi project supported by Kerala Rural Water and Sanitation Agency the organization supported a grama panchayath in Wayanad to provide safe drinking water to the rural people. 4. Watershed Development Program: To enable the community to protect the soil, water and biomass the organization facilitated a grama panchayath in Wayand through people centered watershed development programs with the assistance of NABARD. 5. Facilitation of Agricultural Regeneration Measures: The organization implemented this project in 4 grama panchayaths and one municipality in Wayanad by facilitating agricultural regeneration measures though the promotion of organic farming, micro plan preparation, marketing outlets, Be -Friending services and facilitation programs. 6. Self Help Groups: To develop the bargaining capacity and economic independence of rural women, promoted 105 women self help groups consisting 11000 members. Provided skill development trainings on different trades, initiated 198 Income Generation Units linking with banks. Provided Revolving funds to initiate IGPs. 7. Sustainable development of tribal and marginalized farmers: To promote sustainable development of tribal and marginalized farmers based on their wisdom and traditions, implemented this project in Wayanad district through facilitation programs, collection and mobile exhibition of local variety seeds, organic farming and promotion of community seed banks. Through System of Rice Intensification promoted low cost paddy cultivation in 10 panchayaths of Wayanad district. 8. Research and Studies: The organization published study and reference materials on various subjects covering socio-economic, agricultural, environmental and cultural aspects of society. 9. Advocacy and lobbying: The organization does Advocacy and lobbying with different government agencies for the effective implementation of women, tribal, farmer, child and environment friendly Acts, Laws and Policies. Networking with different regional, national and international social development agencies for the betterment of the society.

sourceOfFunds.purpose: This project aims to empower women to involve in the burning issues they are facing by strengthening district and state coordination committees in association with other like minded organizations. In order to gain the present scenario collected information from courts on the implementation of DV Act. Collected information from police department on the status of cases registered on issues of women and children.Organized women in in unorganized sector. Advocated with concerned departments.

As supporting organization of the project organized capacity building programs on maintenance and sustainability of the project.Provided skill development and awareness generation to tribal women in the project area.Organized street plays in different parts of project area and tribal hamlets to communicate the importance of pure and safe drinking water. Provided training programs on leadership, accounting water meter repairing to beneficiary group leaders. Organized exposure to beneficiaries.

The project was implemented to empower and develop the tribal communities through FRA enacted by GoI to undo the historical injustice done to them. This project was implemented through Adivasi Aikya Samithy a tribal community based organization. Remarkable programs were organized under this project. In association with other organizations demanded the enactment of tribal friendly Acts and Laws in the state. Submitted claim forms. Organized consultations and dialogues. Provided training.

The goal of the project is to promote and protect the rights of women through education, campaign, advocacy and lobbying, networking and capacity building of women groups in Kerala.Providing emotional support and guidance through counseling services. Providing legal support. Pressurizes the state government to enact Prevention of Domestic violence Act and other women friendly Acts and laws.Building up the capacity of women to lead a dignified life. initiates and promotes collective actions.

Jalanidhi was a project supported by Kerala Rural Water Supply and Sanitation Agency to provide pure drinking water to all families in Thondarnadu grama panchayath of Wayanad district with the whole support of community .It was a people centered project. As a support organization assisted the Thondarnadu grama panchayath to implement small and bulk water supply schemes focusing on tribal and marginalized communities.Trained the beneficiary committees for the sustainability of the project.

Watershed Development project was a holistic development program in Karimbil watershed by promoting soil, water and biodiversity conservation programs and addressing livelihood aspects of watershed community. This was a people centered project . The project was implemented through Village Watershed Committee. The amount received in the financial year was to provide capacity building training to Village Watershed Committee and Joint Liability groups promoted under the project.

Organized Taluk level facilitation programs on community rights mentioned in the Act. organized district level consultation on tribal sub plan to educate the tribal about a deeper understanding on the real need of restructuring the distribution of funds under tribal sub plan. Organized legal awareness programs to motivate on the existing tribal acts. Organized consultations on PESA for tribal youth to gain basic knowledge on the subject matter.Provided social analysis and leadership training

This project aims to empower women to involve in the burning issues they are facing by strengthening district and state coordination committees in association with other like minded organizations. In order to gain the present scenario collected information from courts on the implementation of DV Act. Collected information from police department on the status of cases registered on issues of women and children.Organized women in in unorganized sector. Advocated with concerned departments.

As part of the implementation of the project organized district level gathering of adivasies. Organized sensitization programs for tribal students on bio diversity and eco system. .provided emergency health and legal assistance to the needy. organized consultation on climate change and adivasies. Disseminated information on TSP, PESA and FRA with CBOs and NGOs . Submitted claim forms claiming individual and community rights. Organized training on herbal medicines . Distributed solar lights.

Organized house wives in the state under the plat form named National House Wives Association demanding recognition for house hold works and social security measures. Provided capacity building training to women leaders in different districts. Provided emotional support and guidance through counseling center .Provided legal counseling to the needy women. Women leaders had discussion with ministers and concerned departmental persons. organized consultations and seminars .Organized legal classes

As a support organization of the project assisted the grama panchayath to form panchayath level beneficiary group federation for the sustainability of the project. Provided training on accounting and book keeping to federation leaders and beneficiary group leaders.

Provided capacity building training on accounting and book keeping, structuring and managing community based organizations, Provided training on Life skill development, social talk and communication and leadership and personality development. Initiated women resource center equipped with number of books and periodicals related to socio- economic development. Women leaders attended in different meetings and dialogues organized by government agencies, NGOs and network organizations.

detailsOfAchievement: Natural Resource Management: We have completed two water shed programs under western gat and four water shed programmes funded by NABARD is going on. Further a Jalanidhi (Drinking water project ) project funded by World Bank was successfully completed as Koduvally of Calicut district. Organic Certification Programme Organic programme started in the year of 1999. 2000 registered farmers with 3500ha land, good marketing system by paying premium price to the farmers. A spice processing center is functioning for value addition of produces. The Society holds Spices Board certificate for exports CBOs: 750 SHGs are active under 60 federations with more than 40 small entrepreneurs. For promoting dairy 500 cows are being supplied every year by mobilizing local fund. Credit systems operated by the CBOs are reducing the financial instability of its members. Mediclaim insurance and jeevan Madhoor insurance programmes are being implemented. Legal Aid cell Supporting the poor and Marginalized people in the target areas. Awareness programmes for the tribal, amicable settlement outside the court, legal counseling are imparted. Alternative Energy: 200 bio gas plants are constructed every year for reducing carbon emission by using ferro cement technology. Alternative Health: Botanical conservation park, botanical museum, biodiversity park, herbal pants preservation park are situating in the premise of training center where 100 people can make residential training. Tribal Development programme: 7 panchayaths are being taken by the Society for implementing Tribal programme. Nabard is supporting for one panchayath

detailsOfAchievement: Institution Based Rehabilitation (IBR). We provide rehabilitation to various categories of people through our institutions. Psycho-social Rehabilitation Center Home for Physically and Mentally Challenged Children Special School for Mentally Challenged Children Care home for boys and girls Home for unwed and abandoned mothers and children Home for the aged SEARCH (Special Education and Rehabilitation Care Homes) SEARCH is a program for institution based rehabilitation (IBR) and there are 61 IBR centers under the program. Personality development training Counseling Care givers training programs Community Based Rehabilitation Be Able The program envisages helping the persons with disability (PWDs) to enjoy the benefits of various government and non government policies, schemes and programs for their welfare. The project is implemented through Researches and surveys Self- Empowerment Programs Special meetings Advocacy and Networking Forming Self Help Groups (SHGs) STEP (Students Training and Education Program) In 2008 the centre has initiated unique education project called STEP (Students Training and Education Programme) to provide students opportunity to attend the best universities in the country. We have been helping 381 students since its beginning through this programme. CAN (Palliative Care Program) Care and Near program originated in the year 2011 and has been providing care and services to 350 bedridden patients. The home palliative care encompasses Training for Volunteers, Formulation of Home Care Units by regions, Case study and Regular home visit. Independent Projects Housing Project The project runs with the contribution of cash, material and arranging voluntary labor by local people named Karmasena. So far, we have constructed 550 houses under various schemes. NANMA NANMA is a project offering medical support to poor people. The program is supporting 20 regular patients through financial help for medicine and 50. AXSHYA Project The centre is as partner NGO in Kottayam District as part of the recently announced Global Fund Round 9 Axshya TB Project by RNTCP (Revised National Tuberculosis Control Programme) and CHAI (Catholic Health Association India). CHILDLINE CHILDLINE India Foundation (CIF) has appointed WE CARE as the Support Organization for CHILDLINE in Kottayam district in 2011.
